alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Jefferson; Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 6:27PM CDT until July 28 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Illinois, including the following counties, Hamilton, Jefferson, Wayne and White. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain has ended, but light to moderate rain continues. Minor flooding remains possible in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to one half inch are expected over the area. This additional rain may prolong any minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Vernon, Fairfield, Wayne City, Woodlawn, Bluford, Cisne, Dahlgren, Dix, Waltonville, Bonnie, Jeffersonville, Belle Rive, Sims, Mill Shoals, Mount Erie, Keenes, Johnsonville, Golden Gate, Belle Prairie City and Burnt Prairie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
